Giant Panda.description: The modern giant panda, Ailuropoda melanoleuca, is an iconic bear with its distinctive black-and-white fur, powerful jaws, and a specialized thumb-like wrist bone. Native to the mountainous bamboo forests of central China, it has evolved unique adaptations for a near-exclusive bamboo diet, including strong molars and an elongated digestive tract suited for processing plant material. Despite these herbivorous traits, the giant panda belongs to the bear family, Ursidae, and shares common ancestry with omnivorous bears, making its dietary specialization a rare example of evolutionary adaptation.

Kretzoiarctos beatrix.description: A small bear found in Spain, this ancestor shows early bear-panda characteristics with a partially developed pseudo-thumb. It represents one of the earliest steps toward panda specialization.
Kretzoiarctos beatrix.prompt: Illustration of Kretzoiarctos beatrix, an ancient small bear with a blend of panda and bear features, including a partially developed pseudo-thumb, in a Miocene forest of Europe. The bear has a compact, agile build and is surrounded by lush foliage.
